Posted: January 13
												Demo 3D is a tablet game with a forgivable premise - Bridge constructor games meet Angry birds without the birds.   You set explosives on various premade structures and try not to hit red things and try to hit green and yellow things with the falling debris.   What's the problem then?  They didn't put a lot of effort into porting to PC.   The game controls all require "tapping".  There's no graphics or fidelity options - the graphics are at a fixed resolution, very low polygon for PC. Lack of attention to PC specific configuration items and PC fidelity drag this game below the line, unfortunately.   This came very close to a thumbs up, and would certainly score modestly well if Steam gave us a more gradiated choice.  Here's hoping they decide to review their approach and take PC gaming seriously for their next offering.
